sections.heading: bank; reorganization as national bank; vote required
sections.text: Any state bank, without the approval of any state authority, may, upon a vote of the holders of at least two-thirds of its capital stock, convert into and merge or consolidate with a national bank as provided by federal law.SourceLaws 1951, c. 11,

8-180.State bank; reorganization as national bank; vote required.

Any state bank, without the approval of any state authority, may, upon a vote of the holders of at least two-thirds of its capital stock, convert into and merge or consolidate with a national bank as provided by federal law.

SourceLaws 1951, c. 11, ยง 1(3), p. 85;R.R.S.1943, ยง 8-165.02;Laws 1963, c. 29, ยง 80, p. 165;Laws 2017, LB140, ยง 76.
